column5: How do you sharpen a dull hook? Me; I use a hockey skate stone. $2.50 and works better then the battery one's places sell.  Other way's and ideas please share.

I've used files in the past and still have it on the boat to be used as needed. Now I've got this and like it.  http://www.basspro.com/Offshore-Angler-Diamond-Edge-Hook-Sharpening-Handle/product/10206824/  I have various stones for knife blades but never liked them as much for hooks.
Im guilty of never sharpening hooks lol.

Depends....  Walleye Jigs I will sharpen Walleye harnesses I will sharpen Musky hooks I will sharpen  Bass/walleye trebles get changed when damaged/dull Carp hooks get changed when damaged/dull  i use this  https://www.fishusa.com/product/Luhr-Jensen-Original-Hook-File?gclid=COmArdnNytMCFQmQaQodbw0Kdg&gclid=COmArdnNytMCFQmQaQodbw0Kdg
One of these, no batteries required. One in each tackle box.    http://www.cabelas.com/catalog/product.jsp?productId=702057&type=product&WT.ac=YMAL-702057&WT.z_pg_ref=prd2248178
EZ Lap Diamond Hones http://eze-lap.com/hunting_fishing_outdoor_use/hone-stone/  or  A hook file http://www.fishinbc.com/hook-sharpening/

Im guilty of never sharpening hooks lol. Wow, that I never would have figured that Rick. It is absolutely the easiest and best way to increase your hookup percentage, other things being equal. Even having my bullhead handline hooks sticky sharp makes a difference.  Cheers
It's only because I get free jigs/hooks lol
Yellow handle hook file sold every where.

fisherpete recommended one of these bad boys    Ive never looked back. two passes on the outside top, and sides  of the hook and the thing becomes like a magnet...ouch no need to break the bank, these ones with the yellow handle work incredible.   Can anyone confirm the brand, i cant remember!??
